description: Rembrandt painted only a few landscapes, mostly imaginary mountain scenes. Although The Stone Bridgeis composed of elements studied from reality, it probably does not represent a specific place. The painting’smagical quality derives from its dramatic illumination: a beam of sunlight breaks through the clouds, makingthe approaching storm seem twice as menacing.
author: Rembrandt van Rijn
null: landscapes beam specific place storm dramatic illumination stone bridge clouds imaginary mountain scenes magical quality painting sunlight breaks reality rembrandt
